subject: HISTORY
text: In the skeleton chronological chart provided place as many as you can of the following in the appropriate compartments :— The Long Parliament, the Declaration of Independence, the Scottish Reformation, the last Jacobite Rebellion, the persecution of the Lollards, the Seven Years’ War, Chaucer’s Canterbury Tales, the battle of Sedan, the King’s Quhair, the -first Reform Bill, the American Civil War, the battle of Dunbar, the invention of the steam-engine, Clive’s victories in India, the death of Joan of Arc, the battle of Flodden.

subject: HISTORY
text: Explain the circumstances which led to the battle of Harlaw. Describe the traditional incidents of the battle, and estimate its importance.

subject: HISTORY
text: What do you know of the state of the Catholic Church in Scotland just before the Reformation ? Describe the part played by Knox.

subject: HISTORY
text: What part did the Scots play in the English Civil War from the signing of the Solemn League and Covenant to the battle of Dunbar ?

subject: HISTORY
text: What do you know of the state of the Highlands from 1689 to 1745 ? What circumstances helped to make the Jacobite cause popular in Scotland ?

subject: HISTORY
text: Describe the struggle of Greece with Persia.

subject: HISTORY
text: By what stages did Rome become mistress of the Mediterranean, and what was the extent of her empire at its greatest ?

subject: HISTORY
text: Either, Give some account of any two of the following:— Socrates,. Pericles, Alexander the Great, Tarquinius Superbus, Coriolanus, Hannibal, Cicero, Cleopatra. Or, Give some account of any two of the following:— Attila, Charlemagne, Hildebrand, St. Francis of Assisi, David I. of Scotland, John of Gaunt, Joan of Arc, George Buchanan.

subject: HISTORY
text: What were the main causes of the Crusades, and what their effect on western civilization ? Describe any one of the Crusades more particularly.

subject: HISTORY
text: What was the origin of the Hundred Years’ War? Estimate its effect on Scotland, on the power of the Parliament in England, and on France.

subject: HISTORY
text: Describe briefly the cause and course of the struggle between England and Spain in the 16th century, and estimate its effects on both countries.

subject: HISTORY
text: How was the Revolution of 1688 brought about ? On what grounds was it justified ? Contrast its ultimate effect on Scotland and on Ireland.

subject: HISTORY
text: Enumerate the attempts made in the 18th century to tax the- American colonies. What views of Britain’s right to tax the colonies were held by Pitt, Grenville, Burke ?

subject: HISTORY
text: Narrate the events which led up to the battle of Waterloo, and describe the chief incidents of the battle.

subject: HISTORY
text: Sketch the development of any of the great self-governing colonies.

subject: HISTORY
text: Name some of the great English writers of history; indicate the periods with which they have dealt, and characterise any one of them more particularly.
